member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpeg.Version
member.summary: Global library version

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpeg.Execute(System.String)
member.summary: Synchronously executes FFmpeg command provided. Space character is used to split command into arguments.
member.returns: zero on successful execution, 255 on user cancel and non-zero on error

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpeg.Execute(System.String[])
member.summary: Synchronously executes FFmpeg with arguments provided.
member.param: FFmpeg command options/arguments as string array
member.returns: zero on successful execution, 255 on user cancel and non-zero on error

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpeg.Cancel(System.Int64)
member.summary: Cancels an ongoing operation. This function does not wait for termination to complete and returns immediately.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpeg.ListExecutions
member.summary: Lists ongoing executions.

member.name: T:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig
member.summary:
This class is used to configure MobileFFmpeg library utilities/tools.
1. LogDelegate: This class redirects FFmpeg/FFprobe output to NSLog by default. As an alternative, it is possible not to print messages to NSLog and pass them to a LogDelegate function. This function can decide whether to print these logs, show them inside another container or ignore them.
2. setLogLevel:/getLogLevel: Use this methods to set/get FFmpeg/FFprobe log severity.
3. StatsDelegate: It is possible to receive statistics about ongoing operation by defining a StatsDelegate or by calling getLastReceivedStats method.
4. Font configuration: It is possible to register custom fonts with setFontconfigConfigurationPath: and setFontDirectory:with: methods.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.EnableRedirection
member.summary: Enables log and statistics redirection. When redirection is not enabled FFmpeg/FFprobe logs are printed to stderr. By enabling redirection, they are routed to NSLog and can be routed further to a log delegate. Statistics redirection behaviour is similar. Statistics are not printed at all if redirection is not enabled. If it is enabled then it is possible to define a statistics delegate but if you don't, they are not printed anywhere and only saved as 'lastReceivedStatistics' data which can be polled with '{@link #'getLastReceivedStatistics()'. Note that redirection is enabled by default. If you do not want to use its functionality please use 'disableRedirection()' to disable it.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.DisableRedirection
member.summary: Disables log and statistics redirection.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.LogLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets log level.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.FFmpegLogDelegate
member.summary: Sets a LogDelegate. logCallback method inside LogDelegate is used to redirect logs.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.FFmpegStatisticsDelegate
member.summary: Sets a StatisticsDelegate. statisticsCallback method inside StatisticsDelegate is used to redirect statistics.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.LastReceivedFFmpegStatistics
member.summary: Returns the last received statistics data. It is recommended to call it before starting a new execution.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.ResetStatistics
member.summary: Resets last received statistics.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.FontconfigConfigurationPath
member.summary: Sets and overrides fontconfig configuration directory which contains fontconfig configuration (fonts.conf)

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.SetFontDirectory(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Registers fonts inside the given path, so they are available to use in FFmpeg filters.
Note that you need to build MobileFFmpeg with fontconfig enabled or use a prebuilt package with fontconfig inside to use this feature.
member.param: directory which contains fonts (.ttf and .otf files)
custom font name mappings, useful to access your fonts with more friendly names

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.PackageName
member.summary: Returns guessed package name according to supported external libraries

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.ExternalLibraries
member.summary: Returns supported external libraries.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.RegisterNewFFmpegPipe
member.summary:
Creates a new named pipe to use in FFmpeg operations.
Please note that creator is responsible of closing created pipes.
member.returns: the full path of named pipe

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.CloseFFmpegPipe(System.String)
member.summary: Closes a previously created FFmpeg pipe.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.FFmpegVersion
member.summary: Returns FFmpeg version bundled within the library.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.Version
member.summary: Returns MobileFFmpeg library version.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.BuildDate
member.summary: Returns MobileFFmpeg library build date.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.LastReturnCode
member.summary: Returns return code of last executed command.

member.name: P:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.LastCommandOutput
member.summary:
Returns log output of last executed single FFmpeg/FFprobe command.
This method does not support executing multiple concurrent commands. If you execute multiple commands at the same time, this method will return output from all executions.
Please note that disabling redirection using MobileFFmpegConfig.disableRedirection() method also disables this functionality.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.FFmpegConfig.IgnoreSignal(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Registers a new ignored signal. Ignored signals are not handled by the library.
By default, the following 5 signals are handled: SIGINT, SIGQUIT, SIGPIPE, SIGTERM and SIGXCPU. Any of them can be ignored.

member.name: M:Laerdal.Xamarin.FFmpeg.BaseFFmpegConfigImplementation.EnableRedirection
member.summary: Enables log and statistics redirection. When redirection is not enabled FFmpeg/FFprobe logs are printed to stderr. By enabling redirection, they are routed to NSLog and can be routed further to a log delegate. Statistics redirection behaviour is similar. Statistics are not printed at all if redirection is not enabled. If it is enabled then it is possible to define a statistics delegate but if you don't, they are not printed anywhere and only saved as 'lastReceivedStatistics' data which can be polled with '{@link #'getLastReceivedStatistics()'. Note that redirection is enabled by default. If you do not want to use its functionality please use 'disableRedirection()' to disable it.
